p: Manganese is necessary for all biosynthetic processes and maintenance of nerve and muscle electrical potentials. It also functions in oxygen transport from lungs to cells and activation of enzymes reactions associated with the metabolism of carbohydrate, fat, and protein (Jacob et al., 2015). Copper is a vital trace mineral, which is required in several enzymatic reactions, good functioning of organs in the body, collagen synthesis, energy generation, and formation of hemoglobin (DiNicolantonio et al., 2018; Saupi et al., 2009).
